channel.title: Help with player rights/Commands

item.title: Help with player rights/Commands
item.dc:creator: @Rova Rova
item.description:

r Owners.");

item.title: Help with player rights/Commands
item.dc:creator: @Final_Dawn Final Dawn
item.description:
@Final_Dawn wrote:

Oh also one more thing. I wouldn’t make Donator 4 because of the fact that then they can do any command that is moderator plus. Don’t ask me how you can fix this but I can suggest making a character file variable. There is a few tutorials on how to do this so just search for Donator in the search bar.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with player rights/Commands
item.dc:creator: @Rova Rova
item.description:
@Rova wrote:

if (command.startsWith("yell") && playerRights == 1) { String text = command.substring(5); yell("[Owner]["+playerName+"]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } if (command.startsWith("yell") && playerRights == 2) { String text = command.substring(5); yell("[Admin]["+playerName+"]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } if (command.startsWith("yell") && playerRights == 3) { String text = command.substring(5); yell("[Owner]["+playerName+"]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } if (command.startsWith("yell") && playerRights == 4) { String text = command.substring(5); yell("[Donater]["+playerName+"]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

Would this work?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with player rights/Commands
item.dc:creator: @Final_Dawn Final Dawn
item.description:
@Final_Dawn wrote:

Actually I changed it…but if the && works then there you go…but I think that wants the player to have multiple rights which isn’t possbile use the new one…

if (command.startsWith("Command") && playerRights == 3 || playerRights == 2) {

Read full topic

item.title: Help with player rights/Commands
item.dc:creator: @Rova Rova
item.description:
@Rova wrote:

Thanks and if I wanted for rights 1 I just

if (command.startsWith("Command") && playerRights == 3 && playerRights == 2 && playerRights == 1) {

LMAO FUNNY SIG

Well one way to do this is…

item.title: Help with player rights/Commands
item.dc:creator: @Rova Rova
item.description:
@Rova wrote:

I made rank 4 used to be hidden admin to donater rank (Rank 4) so I made all of the commands like == 3 (Owner rank) how Do I make like ::kick work for 1, 2, 3 and not 4…

And make a command work for admins (2) and owners (3) and not moderator or Donater?

What it looks like

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights == 3) { for(int i = 0; i < 21; i++) { addSkillXP(14000000, i); } }

Read full topic
